channel.title: Php function file_get_contents
channel.description:
i always get tired of looking on multiple websites, youtube, facebook etc.
so my idea was to create one page that has everything in it (just for personal use)
i know that the php function file_get_contents() works for this, but what i do not know if there are any risks doing this.. Can i get ip banned on the website for using this? You know i'm really not sure, does anyone have any ideas about this function that maybe can help me to understand it better

item.title: Php function file_get_contents
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

RSCShadow:

Would be a better idea to just frame each of them on one page.

Yes but i would probably not be able to get content between a div for example, that is what i want.
i will look in to curl

edit :
Thanks guys, i figured it out. I might work on a customizable version and release it but that will have to wait

Peace

Read full topic

item.title: Php function file_get_contents
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“KempiScape, post:1, topic:478519”]i always get tired of looking on multiple websites, youtube, facebook etc.

so my idea was to create one page that has everything in it (just for personal use)

i know that the php function file_get_contents() works for this, but what i do not know if there are any risks doing this…
Can i get ip banned on the website for using this? You know i’m really not sure, does anyone have any ideas about this function that maybe can help me to understand it better[/quote]
You won’t get IP banned, however, your server’s IP address may get banned. You’ll probably hit a bunch of mod_sec rules as well. If you don’t have access to whitelist them, then your best is using cURL or else doing what RSCShadow suggested.

Read full topic

item.title: Php function file_get_contents
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

I’ve heard things about screen scraping which is essentially what you’re doing, which I recommend doing some research on. Whether you use file_get_contents() or cURL or the like; it’s the same procedure.

Read full topic
